author: Cinzia Gatti
title: Poste tira dritto e chiude 7 uffici in Piemonte. Bussalino: "Ottenuto Postamat e appoggio dei servizi nei negozi di vicinato"
text:
Poste Italiane tira dritto e il prossimo 16 dicembre chiuder√† cinque uffici postali a Torino e due a Novara. Questa mattina si √® svolto un confronto tra Regione Piemonte con l'assessore agli Enti Locali Enrico Bussalino, la vicesindaca di Torino Michela Favaro, l‚Äôassessore di Novara Maria Cristina Stangalini, il responsabile Relazioni Istituzionali Macro Area Nord Ovest di Poste Italiane S.p.A, Federico Sichel, e il responsabile Gestione Operativa MP Macro Area Nord Ovest, Giovanni Bessi.
L'incontro
L‚Äôincontro √® stato convocato dalla Regione, dopo l‚Äôinvio di una lettera da parte dell‚Äôassessore Bussalino per chiedere un confronto diretto sulle motivazioni alla base del piano di razionalizzazione, che prevede la chiusura di sette uffici postali sul nostro territorio. La notizia ha [suscitato preoccupazione](https://www.torinoggi.it/2024/11/24/leggi-notizia/argomenti/attualita-8/articolo/poste-chiude-cinque-uffici-a-torino-il-sindaco-pronti-a-passare-alle-vie-legali.html), in particolare tra i cittadini pi√π anziani, per i quali l‚Äôaccesso ai servizi postali rappresenta un‚Äôesigenza primaria e lo spostamento verso sedi alternative potrebbe risultare difficoltoso.
La Regione - insieme a Torino e Novara - ha chiesto a Poste Italiane di fare un passo indietro sulle chiusure, proponendo eventualmente una riduzione degli orari di apertura. Una proposta non raccolta dall'azienda, che ha annunciato di voler tirare dritto.
Nuovi Postamat
Le istituzioni hanno rilanciato, chiedendo ed ottenendo, nuovi Postamat. In parallelo verranno attivati anche i ‚ÄúPuntoLIS‚Äù, ovvero punti di appoggio presso negozi di vicinato come tabaccherie e farmacie, dove sar√† possibile accedere a servizi postali di base. Questo per permettere ai residenti di poter ad esempio pagare le bollette e prelevare contante, in particolare nelle aree dove gi√† si registrano carenze di banche.
Cinque uffici chiusi a Torino
Soluzioni che non hanno convinto la vicesindaca Favaro, rammaricata "di non aver incontrato la disponibilit√† ad una rivalutazione n√© un rinvio dei provvedimenti di chiusura". A Torino i presidi che abbasseranno definitivamente le serrande il prossimo 16 dicembre sono: via Nizza 88 (Torino 55), via Francesco Guicciardini 28 (Torino 13); via Verres 1/A (Torino 78); corso Casale 196 (Torino 53) e via alla Parrocchia 3/A (Torino 54). Negli scorsi giorni il sindaco Stefano Lo Russo aveva dichiarato di essere pronto anche a passare alle vie legali.
A condividere la posizione di Favaro i consiglieri regionali del PD Alberto Avetta e Nadia Conticelli, che insieme alla capogruppo regionale di AVS Alice Ravinale chiariscono: "Poste Italiane non pu√≤ ignorare il fronte comune di cittadini ed istituzioni contro la chiusura".

author: Jennifer Campos
title: ¬°Abr√≠gate bien! Frente Fr√≠o n√∫mero 7 llega con lluvias y heladas en estos Estados
text: ¬°Abr√≠gate bien! Frente Fr√≠o n√∫mero 7 llega con lluvias y heladas en estos Estados La Conagua alert√≥ a la poblaci√≥n a tomar precauci√≥n los pr√≥ximos cuatro d√≠as, debido a la bajas temperaturas que se aproximan en el noroeste del pa√≠s [Jennifer Campos](https://www.reporteindigo.com/author/jennifer-campos/) La Comisi√≥n Nacional del Agua (Conagua) alert√≥ a la poblaci√≥n de posibles nevadas en varios Estados de la Rep√∫blica Mexicana para los pr√≥ximos cuatro d√≠as. Adem√°s de la llegada del Frente Fr√≠o n√∫mero 7. Seg√∫n el informe se esperan heladas con temperaturas de -10 a -5 ¬∞C en: - Baja California - Chihuahua - Durango Temperaturas de -5 a 0 ¬∞C en las zonas monta√±osas de: - Sonora [Zacatecas](https://www.reporteindigo.com/reporte/se-avala-reforma-de-supremacia-constitucional-17-congresos-locales-la-aprobaron/) Temperaturas de 0 a 5 ¬∞C en: - Estado de M√©xico - Tlaxcala - Puebla - Aguascalientes - Jalisco - Michoac√°n Te seguimos informando el [#Pron√≥stico]del tiempo para las pr√≥ximas horas en el territorio nacional.Consulta nuestro [#VideoPron√≥stico]intermedio. ¬°Bonita tarde y buen provecho! üòÄ[pic.twitter.com/MM62bWwkXI]‚Äî CONAGUA Clima (@conagua_clima) [November 1, 2024] Frente fr√≠o n√∫mero 7 ocasionar√° lluvias y ca√≠da de aguanieve De igual manera la Conagua inform√≥ que a partir del s√°bado 2 de noviembre ingresar√° al noroeste del pa√≠s el Frente Fr√≠o n√∫mero 7, ocasionando posibles lluvias en gran parte del territorio mexicano. Pidi√≥ precauci√≥n para los residentes de la Sierra de San Pedro M√°rtir en Baja California, Sonora y Chihuahua ya que existe una gran probabilidad de ca√≠da de nieve y aguanieve. El Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional (SMN) dio a conocer sus proyecciones para la temporada 2024-2025, en la que se anticipa la llegada de 48 frentes fr√≠os y siete tormentas invernales. Este pron√≥stico sugiere un invierno activo, caracterizado por la influencia de estos fen√≥menos meteorol√≥gicos que pueden afectar diversas regiones del pa√≠s. El SMN recomienda a la poblaci√≥n ante las bajas temperaturas: - Permanecer en casa y salir solo si es necesario - Abrigarse con ropa adecuada y usar cobijas para dormir - Cubrirse boca y nariz al salir de un lugar caliente - Informar a las autoridades en caso de [personas](https://www.reporteindigo.com/reporte/fibrosis-pulmonar-costoso-padecimiento-adultos-mayores/)en situaci√≥n de riesgo Por otra parte, se mantendr√°n temperaturas calurosas de 35 a 40 ¬∞C en estados como: Sinaloa, Nayarit, Jalisco, Colima y Michoac√°n

author: Scott M. Reid
title: Hiea-Yoon Kang, subject of SafeSport abuse probe, continues to coach at Fullerton College pool ‚Äì Daily News
text:
FULLERTON ‚Äî Hiea-Yoon Kang, suspended from coaching the U.S. Olympic and national artistic swimming teams, continues to coach young athletes at Fullerton College, a location she has tried to keep secret for months, while being investigated by the U.S. Center for SafeSport for allegedly routinely physically, emotionally and verbally abusing swimmers for more than a decade, the Orange County Register has learned.
Kang has been so concerned about keeping the training site for her club, the La Mirada Aquabelles, secret from the media and survivors of her alleged abuse and their parents that she has repeatedly instructed current Aquabelles swimmers and parents not to share the location or times of the group‚Äôs practices with anyone outside of the team, according to three people familiar with the situation and U.S. Center for SafeSport documents obtained by the Register.‚ÄúThe kids, the athletes, were also instructed by parents and the coach to not share the pool location,‚Äù the parent of an Aquabelles and U.S. national team member told a U.S. Center for SafeSport investigator in October. ‚ÄúTo be honest, we are concerned that if our location is found out, that pool may receive phone calls about the coach coaching there and being told about an investigation, those allegations of misconduct and abuse and then we would be without a pool again. So that‚Äôs our, the parents‚Äô fear of letting people know where we practice.‚Äù Kang was suspended by La Mirada city officials from coaching at Splash! La Mirada Regional Aquatics Center, the Aquabelles‚Äô longtime home, in June in the wake of a Register special report detailing dozens of allegations that Kang abused and bullied athletes as young as 9 years old.Kang told parents that she was concerned that if the media or former Aquabelles or U.S. national team members or their parents learned of her new training location that Fullerton College officials would be pressured to also ban her from coaching at the school‚Äôs swimming pool, according to three people and SafeSport documents.Kang kept her secret until Wednesday night when she was spotted conducting lengthy practice under the lights at the Fullerton College Swimming Pool, shouting instructions with a microphone from a chair on the pool deck while wearing a red, white and blue U.S. national team parka with ‚ÄúUSA‚Äù in large letters across the jacket‚Äôs back.Kang did not respond when asked by a reporter as she walked to her car after the practice how many weeks or months her team had been training at the college and whether school officials were aware that she was under investigation by the U.S. Center for SafeSport.An Aquabelles parent then tried to shield Kang from the reporter, extending her hand in front of the reporter‚Äôs face as she escorted the coach to what appeared to be the parent‚Äôs SUV.The U.S. Center for SafeSport since May 2023 has received complaints from as many as 18 swimmers and parents against Kang detailing more than 80 specific allegations over the course of the past 13 years ranging from physical, verbal and emotional abuse, bullying, body shaming, forcing athletes to compete or train while injured or suffering from medical issues that required surgery, and child labor and endangerment abuses, according to SafeSport documents obtained by the Register and interviews.At least five former U.S. national team and Aquabelles swimmers are cooperating with the U.S. Center for SafeSport investigation, according to four people familiar with the investigation.Kang was indefinitely suspended as a U.S. Olympic and national team coach by USA Artistic Swimming, the sport‚Äôs national governing body, on May 9. Kang has been a member of U.S. national team coaching staffs since 2011 and was promoted in January to help prepare Team USA for the World Championships last February and was expected to play a pivotal role in the U.S. bid for its first Olympic medal since 2004. The promotion came 16 months after USAAS CEO Adam Andrasko first received abuse allegations against Kang.But in May, USA Artistic Swimming officials found that ‚Äúthe allegations‚Äù against Kang ‚Äúare concerning enough that at this time organization feels that an indefinite suspension is necessary,‚Äù according to a USA Artistic Swimming document.The USAAS suspension only prevents Kang from coaching the U.S. Olympic and national teams. The U.S. Center for SafeSport has declined to suspend Kang from coaching or interacting with other athletes while it conducts its investigation.Fullerton College president Cynthia Olivo‚Äôs office referred calls about Kang to Miranda Bates, the school‚Äôs director of campus communications.The college has no record of communication with Kang or a rental agreement with her, Bates said. Instead, Fullerton College entered a rental agreement with Friends of Aquabelles Synchro, a non-profit group based in Irvine, on July 2, according to Fullerton College and Internal Revenue Service records. School officials verified Friends of Aquabelles Synchro‚Äôs non-profit status, Bates said.Friends usually pay between $1,500 and $3,580 per month in rent ‚Äúdepending on how many room reservations they have in a given month. Typically, our rentals are about $100 or $200 per room for nonprofits,‚Äù Bates wrote in an email.‚ÄúWe have no record of comments from the community,‚Äù Bates said, so school officials had no reason to look into the agreement.Julie Wang, who is listed as Friends of Aquabelles Synchro‚Äôs contact with the college, and Sayaka Iwato, who is listed on the rental agreement with the school, did not respond to requests for comment. Iwato lives in Milpitas, in the Bay Area, according to property and other public records.‚ÄúI hope that the parents and the coaches who are helping (Kang) eventually or some day soon reflect on their decisions and hopefully will one day decide that the safety of kids is more important than (athletic) success,‚Äù said Miranda Marquez, a former Aquabelles swimmer who alleges Kang physically, emotionally and verbally abused her and pressured her to train while suffering from a kidney stone that required emergency room treatment.La Mirada officials banned Kang from coaching at Splash! in June, a month after the publication of a Register special report based on athlete and parent interviews, SafeSport complaints and recordings detailed how swimmers suffered regular physical abuse by Kang ranging from being required to train as much as 40 hours per week, being forced to train or compete while recovering from surgeries, injuries that required other medical treatment and concussions, to being subjected to hypoxic training that put athletes at risk of losing consciousness underwater. Swimmers have suffered dislocated toes and hyperextended knees and other leg injuries during drills in which Kang has manipulated their legs or feet to the point where some swimmers scream in pain or are left in tears, athletes and parents allege in interviews, complaints and Safe Sport interview recordings. Related Articles Olympics | Biathlon official apologizes to athletes who have suffered mistreatment Olympics | US Biathlon officials ignored sexual harassment and abuse of female racers for decades, athletes say Olympics | Outgoing LA Councilmember Paul Krekorian to help region prep for Olympics and more in new role Olympics | LA28 officials say Trump election won‚Äôt impact Olympics Olympics | Pat Woepse, husband of US women‚Äôs water polo star Maddie Musselman, dies at 31 ‚ÄúThe City recently became aware of an investigation being conducted by U.S. Center for SafeSport regarding allegations against Coach Kang; some of which are alleged to have occurred at Splash! La Mirada Regional Aquatics Center,‚Äù La Mirada city manager Jeff Boynton wrote in an email to the Register in June. ‚ÄúThe City also learned that Coach Kang was recently suspended by USA Artistic Swimming pending the results of the investigation. Out of an abundance of caution, the City made the decision to temporarily suspend Coach Kang from coaching at Splash! La Mirada Regional Aquatics Center until the results of the investigation by SafeSport are known.‚ÄùBoynton said the Aquabelles could continue to train without Kang at the city‚Äôs pool.Instead, Friends of Aquabelles Synchro reached a rental agreement with Fullerton College a month later, an agreement Kang was determined to keep secret, according to SafeSport documents and three people familiar with the situation.Friends of Aquabelles Synchro listed revenue of $139,597 for the 2023 fiscal year, according to documents filed with the IRS. Kang is not listed in the group‚Äôs IRS filings. La Mirada artistic swimming coach on U.S. Olympic staff is suspended amid investigation of abuse complaints Hiea-Yoon Kang suspended by La Mirada from coaching at city pool

author: HispanTV
title: ‚ÄòOposici√≥n venezolana desconoce Constituci√≥n e institucionalidad‚Äô | HISPANTV
text:
Un analista considera ‚Äúgrave‚Äù la postura de la oposici√≥n venezolana de desconocer los mandatos de la Constituci√≥n y de la institucionalidad del pa√≠s.
El analista Juan Alberto S√°nchez Mar√≠n, director de DXMEDIO.COM , ha comentado este jueves para HispanTV los acontecimientos que ocurren en Venezuela, tras elecciones del 28 de julio que dieron la victoria al presidente Nicol√°s Maduro, pero que la extrema derecha no reconoce y asegura que el candidato Eduardo Gonz√°lez Urrutia es el ganador, pese a que seg√∫n los resultados del √≥rgano electoral qued√≥ segundo.
¬øC√≥mo la ultraderecha en Venezuela pretende enga√±ar al mundo? El experto consultado pone en contexto que la oposici√≥n, al participar en las elecciones, se someti√≥ a las reglas establecidas con claridad en la Constituci√≥n, as√≠ como a la institucionalidad que rigen en el pa√≠s bolivariano.
Tribunal Supremo de Justicia revisa resultados electorales en Venezuela | HISPANTV En Venezuela, el Tribunal Supremo de Justicia comenz√≥ a revisar los resultados de las elecciones presidenciales del pasado 28 de julio.
Pero, agrega S√°nchez Mar√≠n, el grupo pol√≠tico opositor Plataforma Unitaria al ver que no gan√≥, ahora dicen que el Consejo Nacional Electoral y el Tribunal Supremo de Justicia ‚Äúno sirven‚Äù y proclaman a su candidato, Gonz√°lez Urrutia, como presidente electo.
A su vez, ‚Äúlos gobiernos europeos y Estados Unidos avalan esos resultados espurios anunciados en una calle en la clandestinidad, no porque los crean, pues saben a ciencia cierta que son un enga√±o, sino porque les convienen, porque ellos mismos son los art√≠fices de la maniobra‚Äù, explica el entrevistado.
Venezuela rechaza informe de ONU: ‚Äúsirve a intereses golpistas‚Äù
Entonces, concluye el analista, ‚Äúlo que est√° en desarrollo en Venezuela es grave, y es un pelda√±o en una escalera larga que busca derrocar el gobierno, dar un golpe de Estado y cortar de tajo el proceso de cambio que vive Venezuela‚Äù.
La finalidad es volver al pasado, al sometimiento ilimitado de Estados Unidos, alerta.
Fuente: HispanTV Noticias

author: Belga Belga
title: Mayotte en alerte rouge cyclonique √† partir de vendredi soir
text:
Mayotte en alerte rouge cyclonique √† partir de vendredi soir
L'archipel de Mayotte sera plac√© en alerte rouge cyclonique vendredi √† 22H00 (20H00 √† Paris) en raison du passage du cyclone Chido, a annonc√© le pr√©fet de ce d√©partement fran√ßais dans l'oc√©an Indien.
[Belga](/journaliste/belga-5fd9b0a1d8ad5844d1b9592e/)Agence
- Publi√© le 13-12-2024 √† 14h58
- √† Mamoudzou, France
"C'est un √©v√©nement in√©dit, d'une extr√™me violence, les vents pourront d√©passer 180 km/h", a expliqu√© Fran√ßois-Xavier Bieuville lors d'une conf√©rence de presse.
Le pr√©fet a appel√© les personnes log√©es dans des habitations pr√©caires, tr√®s nombreuses dans le d√©partement le plus pauvre de France, √† se confiner dans les centres d'h√©bergement ouverts par les autorit√©s.
